item.title: Report E-2023110254
item.description:
Report E-2023110254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: PRAIRIE GROVE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 on Friday, November 3, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Hydrochloric Acid to a customer site (AZZ Inc.) located in Prairie Grove, AR. When the driver began to offload product they immediately noticed the cam-lock connection at the customers connection was dripping, so they shut down the process, cleared the line and shimmed the cam-lock ears. The driver resumed unloading a second time and noticed the fitting continued to drip so they closed the internal valve on top of the tanker trailer and replaced the gasket at the cam-lock connection. When the driver reopened the internal valve, product was released from the CPVC piping system that is connected to the internal valve of the trailer. Approximately 2 cups of product was release and spilled. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

item.title: Report E-2023110264
item.description:
Report E-2023110264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1824 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. MSES personnel then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. The empty 5-gallon jug, all spent absorbents, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023101509

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS NOTICE TO BE WET AND MOVED TO LOADING DOCK. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND REMOVED WET PACKAGE. IN REWRAP RESPONDER OPENED WET PACKAGE AND NOTICE IT WAS LEAKING FROM CAP.
